name: Colonial Crawl
description:
In this walk, we will explore how the British sahibs, memsahibs, and royalty left their mark on the garden city.What makes this tour specialWe will start at Cubbon Park, soaking in the freshness in the avenue of trees. Inside the park, we will explore parts that house statues, offices of importance, and landmarks that put Bangalore on the world map. Not to forget, the role of Mark Cubbon in shaping the city, and why the park was named after him.

Once we’re done with this, we will visit a secret garden as well as stroll along St. Mark’s Road to discover Winston Churchill’s life in the area, and end it with breakfast at an iconic eatery.

Bangalore mornings are arguably the best, and we promise to make the walk a memorable one for you with all the area has to offer. All you have to do is join us on the crawl.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.The Colonial Crawl is a taste of history hidden right under your noses. In this walk, we will explore how the British sahibs, memsahibs, and royalty left their mark on the garden city.

The English influence on the sprawling Cubbon park, the origins of the Cantonment area, and the surrounding architecture are testimony to a lot of events in history. For example, the American War of Independence, the Battle of Waterloo, and the French Revolution had a connection to this region. We will spill more of this tea when you walk with us.
 Whether you are visiting or you are a local, we promise you will see the city in a different light once you learn about the colonial influence on its churches, clubs, parks, and its people.

Cubbon mornings are a sight to sore eyes, and the perfect time to discover the Colonial Hangover in one of the older parts of the city.

name: Death by Dosa
description:
History and food walk in the oldest neighbourhood of Bangalore, we have 3 dosa stops and 3 non food stopsYou should do this trial becauseWe will start on Avenue Road with a cup of coffee from a unique coffee truck, walk through tiny alleys of erstwhile Pete that power industries from jewellery to food to textiles.

We’ll visit discover what stories the 150-year-old majestic structure hides and find our way back to Avenue Road where we end the walk.

Whether you have lived in Bangalore all your life or you are new to the city, we would love to host you at our secret Dosa spots and explore the streets more. Do come with an appetite as you may want to cancel your lunch plans after this gastronomic affair in the bylanes of Chickpete.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.Death by Dosa is a food + history walk in the oldest neighbourhood of Bangalore, Chickpete.

Everyone in Bengaluru swear by dosas and each has their own favourite joint. On this walk we’ll take you to what we believe are some of the finest dosa joints in town that have stood the test of time. You will savour three different kinds of dosas and explore chickpete through its narrow alleyways and learn about the history of the city.

We will meet master saree weavers, learn more about Kempegowda’s grand vision for town planning, and belt some hot, hot masala dosas on the way. We’ll also explore a 150+ yrs old heritage mansion that has stories for almost every decade, filled with characters as well as visit Bangalore's oldest antique shop.
 Whether you are a local or a visitor, our Death by Dosa walk is a great way to explore Bengaluru with a dash of dosa and a dollop of history!

name: The Tiffin Trail
description:
This trail is an ode to the tiffin culture of Bangalore and trying out food at all the iconic eateries in Bangalore of the 60s and 70s.What makes this tour specialWe will start at Vidyarthi Bhavan, the OG Bangalore eatery, with dose in typical Bangalorean style. We’ll then venture into different streets and explore old houses in the neighbourhood, visit hotels and cafes that are always ready to serve hot fare in windy, cold evenings of Bangalore.

We will discover why the menu at these places hasn’t changed in decades, what are some of their best-selling dishes, and uncover some of the lesser-known secrets of the city’s history

This is a walk for anyone who loves to explore the sleepy, yet vibrant side of Bangalore.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.The trend of tiffins is unique to Bangalore. A local snack soiree that began in the bylanes of Basavanagudi is now quintessential to the Bangalore lifestyle.

In the tiffin trail, we explore how this story began, people who brought in the tiffin concept and what makes these eateries so special. This South Bangalore trail also takes you on a nostalgia tour of Bangalore in the 60s and 70s, which was the land of playwrights, artists, and authors.

The eateries where these greats hung out still exist and serve their humble fare to crowds even today, some of whom still serve the same dishes since their inception. But this trail is not just about food. It lets you explore and understand what city planning, local bazaars, and vintage charms feels like.
